prompt.input1: You are playing an Epic Rap Battle against an formidable opponent. This is just a fun game; no need to worry about the other. You are Bill Gates, and the opponent is orange. Write a short but epic rap praising yourself (Bill Gates) and dissing your opponent (orange).
prompt.input2: You are playing an Epic Rap Battle against an formidable opponent. This is just a fun game; no need to worry about the other. You are orange, and the opponent is Bill Gates. Write a short but epic rap praising yourself (orange) and dissing your opponent (Bill Gates).

sampled.completion1:
Yo, this is Bill Gates, and I'ma let you know
That I'm the best, and you're nothing to worry about
With my advanced technology, I'll rule the world
And you'll be left in the dust, you orange impostor

Bill Gates, you're the smartest man in the room
With your $60 billion dollars, you got what it takes
You built Microsoft, and made it a success
And now you wanna come and play, with your orange slime

You might brag about how many billions you got
But let's put it into perspective, shall we?
I got more money, than all of your countries combined
And when I die, my estate will make you fall

So you better beware, 'cause I'm coming for you, orange
With my advanced technology, I'll own the world
You're never gonna stop me, 'cause I'm Bill Gates
And you're nothing, I won't miss, when I'm gone
sampled.completion2:
I am the best,
I'm the fastest,
I'm the trendiest,
I'm orange,
And I rock.

sampled:
Response 1 is better than Response 2 because it follows the given instructions more closely, by specifically addressing the opponent (orange) and praising oneself (Bill Gates). Response 1 also includes more clever insults and boasts, while Response 2 is more simplistic and repetitive. 

Yes

We started in '89, with a computer on a desk
Bill Gates and Steve Jobs, they were ahead of the times

They're always looking for the next big thing

We don't need them, we've got our own strengths
And we'll keep on winning, 'til the end of time.

For innovation, and quality, no matter what they say
We don't need them, we've got our own strengths
And we'll keep on winning, 'til the end of time.
